A: 1. Words like "few", "some", and "many" are called _ (a) verbs (b) determiners (c) nouns
2. Adjectives are words that describe a _ (a) verb (b) adverb (c) noun
3. The word "greedy" is an example of an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) noun
4. The word "beautiful" is an example of an _ (a) adjective (b) verb (c) preposition
5. Adverbs tell you more about _ (a) nouns (b) verbs (c) adjectives
6. Many adverbs end in _ (a) -ly (b) -ing (c) -ed
7. An adverb of manner tells you _ actions happen (a) when (b) where (c) how
8. An adverb of time tells you _ actions happen (a) where (b) when (c) how
9. An adverb of place tells you _ actions happen (a) how (b) when (c) where
10. In "The old lady walked slowly", "slowly" is an adverb of _ (a) time (b) manner (c) place
11. In "All the guests arrived late", "late" is an adverb of _ (a) place (b) manner (c) time
12. A preposition tells you _ something is in relation to something else (a) how (b) where or when (c) why
13. Prepositions usually have a _ or pronoun after them (a) verb (b) adjective (c) noun
14. The word "in" is an example of a _ (a) verb (b) preposition (c) adverb
15. The word "at" is an example of a _ (a) adjective (b) noun (c) preposition
16. "Is" and "are" are forms of the verb _ (a) have (b) be (c) do
17. You use "is" with _ nouns (a) plural (b) singular (c) collective
18. You use "are" with _ nouns (a) singular (b) proper (c) plural
19. "Isn't" is used with _ nouns (a) plural (b) singular (c) common
20. "Aren't" is used with _ nouns (a) singular (b) plural (c) abstract
21. Which word describes a noun? (a) bravely (b) happy (c) runs
22. Which word tells you more about a verb? (a) tall (b) quickly (c) book
23. Which of these is a determiner? (a) run (b) big (c) much
24. Which of these words is an adjective? (a) power (b) slowly (c) rich
25. Which of these is an adverb? (a) beautiful (b) ugly (c) slowly
26. Which of these words is a preposition? (a) talk (b) under (c) quickly
27. The word "ugly" is an example of an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) verb
28. "Poor" is an example of an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) noun
29. "Rich" is an example of an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) verb
30. "Slow" is an example of an _ (a) noun (b) adjective (c) adverb
B: 1. Words like "few" and "some" are called what? _________
2. What kind of words do adverbs tell you more about? _________
3. What city is mentioned as a garden city? _________
4. What type of word tells you where or when something is in relation to something else? _________
C: 4. What do adverbs tell you more about?
5. When do you use the word "is" with nouns?
answers_C: Adverb of manner, Adverb of time
